meanings.definition: Relating to the variation of the form of a word to express different grammatical categories such as number, case, gender, tense, mood, etc.
meanings.sent1: The declensional endings on the nouns show if they are singular or plural.
meanings.sent2: In Latin, students learn about declensional changes in nouns to understand grammar better.
meanings.sent3: The declensional dance of words in sentences can be quite entertaining to language enthusiasts.
meanings.sent4: Her mood swings were as declensional as the conjugation of verbs in a complex language.
meanings.sent5: The declensional shifts in the language made it challenging for beginners to grasp the rules.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the inflection of nouns, pronouns, adjectives, or verbs to indicate number, case, gender, tense, mood, etc.
meanings.sent1: The declensional changes in the pronouns help clarify who is speaking.
meanings.sent2: Teachers explain the declensional forms of adjectives to help students with sentence structure.
meanings.sent3: The declensional cupcakes at the grammar party were a hit among the guests.
meanings.sent4: His declensional choices in conversation reflected his ever-changing perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The declensional variations in the language added depth and richness to its expression.
